info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 2:37PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Berks County through 315 PM EDT... At 236 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Womelsdorf, or near Myerstown, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kutztown, Hamburg, Fleetwood, Laureldale, Womelsdorf, Wernersville, Topton, Robesonia, Leesport, Shoemakersville, Bernville, Lyons, Strausstown, Lenhartsville, Fairview Hgts, Spring Ridge and Centerport. This includes Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
